item.title: I got a problemwith my serer client when i load it need help
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Make sure the loaded sprite has a width (ie is valid), perhaps use a cache editor to go through your cache.

item.title: I got a problemwith my serer client when i load it need help
item.dc:creator: @amshay123 amshay123
item.description:
@amshay123 wrote:

this is the array

private void drawLogo() { 
	byte abyte0[] = titleStreamLoader.getDataForName("title.dat");
	Sprite sprite = new Sprite(abyte0, this);
	if(normalLogin == true) {
		leftSideFlame.initDrawingArea();
		sprite.method346(0, 0);
		rightSideFlame.initDrawingArea();
		sprite.method346(-637, 0);
		aRSImageProducer_1107.initDrawingArea();
		sprite.method346(-128, 0);
		aRSImageProducer_1108.initDrawingArea();
		sprite.method346(-202, -371);
		loginScreenArea.initDrawingArea();
		sprite.method346(-202, -171);
		gameLogo.initDrawingArea();
		sprite.method346(0, -265);
		aRSImageProducer_1113.initDrawingArea();
		sprite.method346(-562, -265);
		aRSImageProducer_1114.initDrawingArea();
		sprite.method346(-128, -171);
		aRSImageProducer_1115.initDrawingArea();
		sprite.method346(-562, -171);
		int ai[] = new int[sprite.myWidth];

what should i do about it to make it work?

item.title: I got a problemwith my serer client when i load it need help
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

I’m assuming your code is dynamically generating an array, ie

The variables which determine its size are summing up to be below 0 (which is impossible). You’ll need to review the array at client.java, line 4123 and check the values of related variables to suss out the issue.

Read full topic
